CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 11, 1961, page 15, reads: "A Credit to the City - As a salute to civic minded residents in the Homewood Brushton area, Pittsburgh Mayor Joseph S. Barr congratulates Samuel Anderson, president of the 7200 Hermitage Street Block Club, which, when recently organized, became the 75th block club of the Homewood Community Improvement Association (HCIA). Shown observing are, left to right: William S. Howell, HCIA president; Mrs. Ora Sims, field secretary of the HCIA, and George McChesney of the Mayor's Commission on Human Relations. Mayor Barr said: 'The formation of 75 block clubs to assist the Pittsburgh Renaissance Movement is a credit to Pittsburgh and an example for other neighborhoods.' - Harris Photo"
TitMainTitle: Pittsburgh Mayor Joseph S. Barr, William S. Howell, Samuel Anderson shaking hands with mayor, Ora Sims, and George McChesney, standing in Office of the Mayor, City County Building
